кавалей

Нэрэц быў абавязаны адпомсціць за напады баттанійцаў на нашую зямлю. Ён выступіў у паход з усімі сіламі, якія змог сабраць. Вландыйцы здрадзілі нам, але гэтага і варта было чакаць ад ганебных барбараў. Фартуна спрыяла ворагу. Важна, што мы паступілі па гонары.
Я не ведаю, хто вы, але я ў вас у абавязку. Гэтыя разбойнікі павялі б нас на смерць.
Паслухаў раду {MENTOR.LINK}, вы стварылі дзяржаву, каб супрацьстаяць Імперыі. Вы можаце сказаць {?MENTOR.GENDER}ёй{?}яму{\?}, што вы будзеце будаваць сваё ўласнае гаспадарства.
Стварыце Свой Клан

Ува ўсіх гарадах былі свае праекты, у якіх увесь час патрабавалі як кваліфікаваную, гэтак і некваліфікаваную працоўную сілу. Вы даведаліся, як будуюцца падымачы і будаўнічыя рыштаванні, як абчэсваюцца і падганяюцца дошкі і камяні, а таксама атрымалі іншыя навыкі.
служыў конюхам барона.

Вы натыкаецеся на куфар, у якім ляжыць стары кавалак бронзы. Гэтак пабіты і праржавелы, што мог быць чым заўгодна - ад кубка да кароны. Мабыць, гэты куфар неяк датычны да 'Дурасці Нэрэца', пра які {?MENTOR.GENDER}згадвала{?}згадваў{\?} {TACTEOS.NAME}.

Я збег, адзін з яго людзей, ледзь болей вінаваты за іншых, пераразаў мае кайданы, калі іншыя спалі, але я не магу дазволіць здрадніку жыць. Таму я вырашыў знайсці вас і прапанаваць угоду.[if:idle_angry][ib:warrior]
Вашая сям'я была гандлярамі, якія жылі ў адным з буйных рачных партоў Стургіі. Яны арганізоўвалі даставу дарункаў поўначы: футра, мёду і іншых тавараў у далёкія краіны.
Мы шукаем двух дзяцей, захопленых налётчыкамі. Вы можаце нам штосьці расказаць?

З'явіліся імперскія катафракты, браняваныя з ног да галавы, і іх коні таксама, так што яны проста ігнаравалі нашую стральбу і прарываліся праз нас. Я быў змецены пры адступленні і болей не бачыў бітвы. У караля Дэрзарта быў досыць добры план, але бароны Інгольтэ і Альдрык проста праігнаравалі яго, як заўсёды робяць.

Вашая сям'я была дробнымі земляробамі, у якіх было дастаткова зямлі, каб прахарчаваць сябе і атрымаць невялікі прыбытак. Такія людзі, як яны, былі слупамі эканомікі гаспадарства, а таксама апорай рушэння.

Наш стары любы гаспадар Эрыл, выдатны чалавек, але з сэрцам, магчыма, занадта пяшчотным, не жадаў, каб мы адпраўляліся на вайну. Але потым ён знік, і я, яго зяць, стаў гаспадаром. Кланы абвясцілі вайну! Яны хацелі адпомсціць за злачынствы, што здзяйсняліся супраць іх цягам стагоддзяў. Я, бацька свайго народа, даў ім тое, чаго яны жадалі.
Мы думаем, што яны сышлі на поўнач. Напэўна тут ёсць некалькі чалавек, якія будуць гатовы далучыцца да вас, калі вы заплаціце за іх рыштунак.
У вас скончылася ежа. На поўначы адгэтуль ёсць вёска з назвай {VILLAGE_NAME}, дзе можна набыць правізію і знайсці дапамогу.
Валодайце {?IS_IMPERIAL}Імперскім Селішчам{?}Селішчам{\?}
Можа. Але калі мы гэта зробім, вы не выжывіце.
Я гатовы, наперад!
Гэта была трагедыя, якая грызла карані ўсіх вялікіх сем'яў Кальрадыі, нават нашых, гэткіх далёкіх ад бітвы.
{PLAYER_BROTHER.NAME} - старэйшы брат {PLAYER.LINK}. Ён адправіўся на пошукі двух малодшых чальцоў сям'і, {PLAYER_LITTLE_BROTHER.NAME} і {PLAYER_LITTLE_SISTER.NAME}.
Вы пацярпелі паразу ад налётчыкаў у сховішчы, але вам удалося збегчы. Вам патрэбна пачакаць пэўны час, перш чым атакаваць ізноў.
працавалі ў вясковай кузні.
Вашая сям'я валодала кузняй у горадзе. Ваш бацька граў актыўную, хоць і другарадную ролю ў гарадской радзе, а таксама служыў у рушэнні.
Увайсці на трэніроўчае поле.

Вось чаму я навучыўся за ўсё сваё жыццё ў палітыцы: няма нічога горш за бязладзіцу. Досыць сказаць, што я лепей за іншых ведаю пра хлусню і жорсткасць, якія падтрымвалі жыццё Імперыі. Але ўсе забойствы, якія я ўчыніў за 10 гадоў на службе ў Нэрэца, не прыраўнаюцца з колькасцю загінулых за адну гадзіну штурму горада войскам.
Калі з-за раптоўнага шторму мясцовы ручай знянацка падняўся, вашым суседзям спатрэбілася хуткадумнае кіраўніцтва. Вы далі яго, загадаўшы ім будаваць дамбу для выратавання дамоў.

Маладыя рэкруты, хударлявыя, альбо занадта бедныя для набыцця шчыта і брані, звычайна ўступаюць у шэрагі застрэльшчыкаў. Ваюючы лукам і дроцікамі, яны імкнуцца заставацца па-за дасягальнасцю асноўных сіл ворага.
Змагацца супраць змовы!
Зарабіце 1000 дэнароў
Прыйшоў час вырашыць гэтае! У атаку!
Мы ведаем хто вы. Нам сказалі даглядаць за вамі. Мы ведаем, што вы задумваеце з {MENTOR.NAME}. Вы пацерпіце няшчасце і памроце.
Я выклікаю цябе на дуэль нахабнік! Здохні, сабака!
Твае людзі забілі маіх бацькоў. Ты сапраўды думаў, што пазбегнеш кары?
Вы можаце стварыць сваё ўласнае гаспадарства або падтрымаць ужо існае...

Не дазваляйце вашаму сумленню мучыць вас з-за таго, што вы мяне адпусцілі. Я болей не буду гандляваць рабамі. Спалена зашмат мастоў са сваімі старымі паплечнікамі, так бы мовіць.Я знайду іншы спосаб зарабіць сабе на жыццё, магчыма найміцтвам. Так ці інакш, мабыць, нашыя шляхі яшчэ перасякуцца.

Вашыя бацькі не далі вам шмат грошаў, але пакінулі досыць, каб вы змаглі набыць пляцоўку некарыстанай зямлі на ўскрайку вёскі. Вы расчысцілі камяні і выкапалі арашальны роў, вырасцілі некалькі сезонаў ураджаю, а потым прадалі яго са значным прыбыткам.
Вы схапілі лук і паслалі некалькі стрэлаў у бок налётчыкаў. Яны схаваліся, даўшы вам з братам магчымасць збегчы.
далучыліся да керну.
Я проста правяраў сёе-тое. Можаш ісці.
Ускокнуўшы на двух пакінутых у падпаленай стайні карчмы коней, вы з братам вырваліся з атачэння налётчыкаў і паскакалі прэч.
Бараніцеся зверху.
Імперыя валодае геніем разбурэння, разбурэння моў, традыцыяў і багоў. Яны захопліваюць нашыя крэпасці, забіваюць нашых людзей і ператвараюць нашых дзяцей у сваіх уласных.
Вітаю, {?PLAYER.GENDER}пані{?}панове{\?}. Чаму вы спынілі нашы караван? Спадзяюся, вы не рабуеце нас.
У дзяцінстве вас адзначылі за...
далучыўся да персаналу камандзіра.
І нарэшце, вам патрэбен капітал. Падыдзе ўсякае селішча, абы яго жыхары гаварылі на імперскай мове.
Яны перабраліся ў іншае сховішча.

Зручная лягенда, так? Зразумела, кальрадыйцы шмат разоў цярпелі паразу, але, зразумела, яны не былі 'сапраўднымі сынамі'. Тым не менш, можна сказаць, што яна увасабляе сілу і трываласць гэтай імперыі.
Зараз перад табой две дарогі, маё дзіцё!
Адхіліць

Магчыма, Нэрэц паступіў неразважліва, калі адправіў нашую пяхоту на ўзгоркі для штурму баттанійскага форта. Але ён лічыў, што зможа хутка захапіць перавал, перш чым вораг паспее яго ўмацаваць. Калі б ён зрабіў іншую стаўку і яна апынулася няслушнай, людзі б сказалі, што ён быў нерашучым.
Абярыце іншую зброю або перайдзіце на іншую трэніроўчую пляцоўку.
Вы працавалі наёмным рукамі ў гарадской стайні. Кіраўнікі прызнавалі, што вы ўмееце абыходзіцца з коньмі, і вам дазвалялася трэнераваць іх, а часам нават абкатваць новых.
You were able to grab a knife in the confusion of the attack. You stabbed a raider blocking your way.

The barbarians just kept coming and coming. I fought my way out with some loyal men, and made my way back to the capital. But I found that Arenicos had got there before me, and had himself declared Emperor. He always was a cunning operator.
A sad day for the Banu Qild. But we had our vengeance.
Buy 2 {GRAIN}{.s}. Click "Buy Products" option on village menu to buy products.
You have failed to defeat all raider parties in time. Many of the locals feel that you've brought misfortune upon them, and want nothing to do with you.
You have defeated the caravan and acquired its supplies, {OTHER_MENTOR.LINK}'s allies will not have their weapons. This will give us time and resources to prepare.
Бараніцеся злева.
Hunt the gangs of {RAIDER_NAME}

Yours wasn't the kind of reputation that local legends are made of, but it was the kind that wins you respect among those around you. You were consistently fair and honest in your business dealings and helpful to those in trouble. In doing so, you got a sense of what made people tick.
Before we do anything else... We're low on food. There's a village north of here where we can buy provisions and find some help. You're a better rider than I am so I'll let you lead the way...
Destroy Raiders

Most children around you had only the most rudimentary education, but you lingered after class to study letters and mathematics. You were fascinated by the marketplace - weights and measures, tallies and accounts, the chatter about profits and losses.
Eliminate {FACTION}
How can I create my own imperial kingdom?
You took your family's goods to the nearest town to sell your produce and buy supplies. It was hard work, but you enjoyed the hubbub of the marketplace.
I am still trying to decide what to do...
So glad to see you safe. Is everyone okay?

Maybe it was a love affair, or maybe you cheated at dice, or maybe you just chose your words poorly when drinking with a dangerous crowd. Anyway, on one of your trips into town you got into the kind of trouble from which only a quick tongue or quick feet get you out alive.
You saved your brother and sister, and you decided to let {RADAGOS.LINK} go...
About the task you gave me...
Current Party Size
My informants will tell me once you pledged your support...
You talked with {HERO.LINK} and got some valuable information that may help you understand the artifact.
{MENTOR.LINK} has sent you a message; about bandit attacks near {TARGET_SETTLEMENT} and advised you to go there and eliminate them all before their actions provoke the locals against your movement.
Growing up, you spent most of your time...

Our knights spotted a mass of Aserai light infantry spread across a valley, and charged them. They weren't ready to meet the onslaught, and were routed. But then a bunch of Khuzaits showed up and kept their distance, giving the knights a hard time, shooting their horses out from under them. That's when we showed up.

Let me tell you about myself... I was a confidant of the old emperor Neretzes. Officially I was not his spymaster, as I am a woman, but that was the role I played nonetheless. I liked Neretzes, and was very grateful for his trust, but he was not a good emperor. Too stubborn and principled. I probably should have poisoned him.

The bravest and most valiant son of our clan, Nimr, led off a large group of Aserai warriors to fight for the Empire, for gold and glory. I went with them. When we saw the Battanian archers come down from the hills, Nimr was ready. He gave the word: we held our shields over our heads as the arrows rained down, then threw our javelins and charged. We cut them down.
You need to have at least {NUMBER} member in your party to deal with the raider party. Go back to village to recruit more troops.
Now things have changed, of course. You choose whichever faction you feel you could best work with.
Recruit troops
Exhausted from the war, the clans of the {FACTION} offer to make peace with the {PLAYER_SUPPORTED_FACTION}.
Hire 1 Companion
My little birds will tell me once you pledge your support...
you tricked the raiders.
Despite its Dragon Banner, the {PLAYER_SUPPORTED_KINGDOM} has been destroyed!

I am afraid I haven't seen any children. But after our caravan was attacked, the chief of the raiders, the one they call Radagos, took and rode off with our more valuable belongings, including a chest that I had.
I am not sure. I haven't made up my mind about this.
You have successfully rebuilt your clan.
I am working on it.

Your family scraped up the money for a rudimentary schooling and you took full advantage, reading voraciously on history, mathematics, and philosophy and discussing what you read with your tutor and classmates.
You successfully assembled the Dragon Banner of Calradios.
We'll see...

Then the Vlandian knights came. We were attacked on two sides and the Emperor, who could have sent men to save us, took his time. Perhaps he wanted the best of the Aserai to die, lest we become too powerful later. But that betrayal was nothing compared to what we received from our fellow Aserai of the Banu Qild.
{PLAYER_LITTLE_SISTER.NAME} is the little sister of {PLAYER.LINK}. She has been abducted by bandits, who intend to sell her into slavery.
with your tutor.
You and your men were defeated by {BOSS_NAME} and his conspirators. Rest of your men finds your broken body among the bloodied pile of corpses. Yet you live to fight another day.
You have collected all the pieces of the Dragon Banner. Now you can decide what you will do with the pieces. Return to {IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK} and {ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK} to decide your path.

Good Heaven, I'll need a better description than that. My men have harvested dozens of little brats in this region. Quite good hunting grounds! Already sent most of them south to a slave market I know, though.[ib:confident]
Conspiracy Caravan
{MENTOR.NAME}'s House
Insults his most powerful vassal and then insults his most valued ally. A fine day's work, wouldn't you say? But he has grown wiser since, though no more pleasant to spend time with.
Go back to training.
What happened? Did you find the banner piece?
were a chieftain's servant.
Conspiracy Quest Available
As a youngster growing up in Calradia, war was never too far away. You...
This option is disabled during tutorial phase.
I'm going to run the course. I need to know I can fight if I have to. (Continue tutorial)
Try again.
So, can you help me find a buyer for it?
Атакуйце справа.

If the wolf pup gang of your early childhood had an alpha, it was definitely you. All the other kids followed your lead as you decided what to play and where to play, and led them in games and mischief.
Before I answer, you and I need to know more about each other. I don't know what you know about me. I was a citizen of the Empire. I was a commander in the imperial armies. But I am not imperial.
Good. Then I will tell you what I know. I heard about one other piece.[sp:/Sounds/VO/mainquest/mntemp_q01_09.ogg]
Your hometown was briefly placed under siege, and you were called to defend the walls. Everyone did their part to repulse the enemy assault, and everyone is justly proud of what they endured.
caring for horses.

It was Sturgians who met Neretzes' guard face-to-face. My father ordered me to stay back as he led them into battle, but he was at their head. He forced them back, then they broke and ran for the shelter of their camp. We went and attacked their ramparts, and broke them, but my father was hit by an imperial mace at the moment of his triumph and died.
Many Qildi youth went with him. They died in their hundreds. And there was no gain - except for Nimr, who for some reason people considered a hero. It was despicable how they fawned on him.
You said talking was a waste of time. You are {RADAGOS.NAME}'s property, now.
I'll need to take these men with us. {RADAGOS.NAME} is a slippery one. I don't want him getting away.
Now, when you are ready to declare your new kingdom, instruct the governor of your capital to have a proclamation read out throughout your lands.
Your family were merchants in one of the main cities of the Empire. They sometimes organized caravans to nearby towns, and discussed issues in the town council.
It will not be easy, but I can explain in detail...
Conspiracy Troops
I can live with that. Let's go.
If I win I will just kill you and let these poor excuses you call conspirators run away.

Are you sure about that? (This option will finish the tutorial, which has story elements, and start the full single player campaign. It is recommended that you pick this option only if you have already played the tutorial once.)
A noyan's kinsfolk
I'm the ruler of the {FACTION}. I shall bear the Dragon Banner.

Shall we get on the road? Remember - if I drop dead of exhaustion, or drown in some river, that's it for your little dears. I don't expect a cozy palanquin, now, but you'd best not make it too hard a trip for me.

{RADAGOS.LINK} said that he knows where your siblings are. He offered to attack together. He will wait for you at the hideout that he mentioned about near {SETTLEMENT_LINK}. You can see the hideout marked on the map.
Oasis farmers
Look, we can still talk. I'll give you a pouch of silver.
You've been defeated at {HIDEOUT_BOSS.LINK}'s hideout. You can attack again when you are ready.
About founding my own faction..
Hit all of the targets. {REMAINING_TARGET} {?REMAINING_TARGET>1}targets{?}target{\?} left.
Tutorial is over. You are now free to explore Calradia.
I am not sure I share your views.

There's nothing special about our Empire. Any one of these petty kings and khans and sultans could probably get lucky and conquer Calradia and do as good a job ruling it as we did. But the point is - we already did it. Our greatest crimes are in the past. Let us not undo what has already been done.
Members of the chieftain's hearthguard
your way with people.
marched with the camp followers.
Welcome to MBII Bannerlord
Your family owned a few horses at the town stables and you took charge of their care. Many evenings you would take them out beyond the walls and gallup through the fields, racing other youth.
See you there then. But, remember, if this is a trap or something, that will cost you your life.
Finish the track and hit as many targets as you can.
Very nice. Superstitious twaddle, of course, but people will believe you. Very well, oh heir to Calradios, go forth!
Settlement Count
Take a hostile action
you rode off on a fast horse.
Find {RADAGOS.LINK}' hideout.

Your father was part of one of the slave-bodyguards maintained by the Aserai emirs. He fought by his master's side with tribe's armored cavalry, and was freed - perhaps for an act of valor, or perhaps he paid for his freedom with his share of the spoils of battle. He then married your mother.
You can use our family name if you like or make up a new one. You will have a better chance of obtaining an audience with nobles and it'll be easier for me to find you by asking around.
Conspiracy War Party
Find the hideout that Istiana told you about and get the next banner piece.
We have no time to lose. We can do more if we split up. (Skip tutorial)
You've successfully finished the sword tutorial.
My wolves! Kill them!
trained with the cavalry.
Mount the horse.
{PLAYER_LITTLE_BROTHER.NAME} is the little brother of {PLAYER.LINK}. He has been abducted by bandits, who intend to sell him into slavery.
Find and meet {HERO.LINK} to learn more about Neretzes' Banner. She is currently in {SETTLEMENT}.
We have strayed too far from our path. I'll take the lead for some time. You follow me.
I wasn't there. I know {HERO.LINK} has some thoughts about it.
Nah... There's no more talking. Kill me or I kill you, that's how this ends.[ib:confident]
Well, that's what some people call the great Battle of Pendraic in the year 1077.
The ruler of the {PLAYER_SUPPORTED_FACTION} has accepted the peace offered by the war-ravaged {FACTION}.
Create {?IS_IMPERIAL}an imperial faction{?}a non-imperial kingdom{\?}
Go to the trainer.
Of course I can. You know my name, whose son I am.
This option is disabled during tutorial stage.

I don't know much about it. I know two who might, though. {IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK} - she once served as Neretez's unofficial spymaster. Then there's {ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK}. He served on Neretzes' bodyguard, but people say now he's very different than he was back then.

Your father was a member of a boyar's druzhina, the 'companions' that make up his retinue. He sat at his lord's table in the great hall, oversaw the boyar's estates, and stood by his side in the center of the shield wall in battle.
Rescue Your Family
Talk with Headman {HEADMAN.FIRSTNAME}
Urban traders
Perhaps by saving my brother and sister you earned your life back. Very well, go now.
{PLAYER_MOTHER.NAME} was the mother of {PLAYER.LINK}. She was slain when raiders attacked the inn at which her family was staying.
{KINGDOM_NAME} is now defeated. You've Failed!

Splendid! But I have a few things to do. There is a hideout near this city. {HIDEOUT_BOSS.LINK} keep your siblings there. I will join you right where the path leads up, just out of sight of their scouts.[if:idle_normal][ib:normal]
Track started.
Your family arranged for a private tutor and you took full advantage, reading voraciously on history, mathematics, and philosophy and discussing what you read with your tutor and classmates.

Wolves, bears are a constant menace to the flocks of northern Calradia, while hyenas and leopards trouble the south. You went with a group of your fellow villagers and fired the missile that brought down the beast.
{IMPERIAL_MENTOR.NAME}'s Plan

Such are the fortunes of war. But what came afterwards... When word spread of what happened to our menfolk, the other clans - the Arkits in particular - knew we were weak. Our herds were raided. Anyone who protested was killed. Monchug did little to stop it. It taught us that valor will get you killed, but treachery will make you rich.
Of course. I intend to use the banner to help save the Empire.
The ruler of the {FACTION} is leading the alliance against you. Defeat their armies or force them to make peace by capturing their settlements and destroying their parties to achieve victory.
No, I need more time to decide.
Meet me there later, when you're ready to tell me everything.[if:idle_normal][ib:normal]

Calradia is a land full of peril - but also opportunities. To face the challenges that await, you will need to build up your clan.{NEWLINE}Your brother told you that there are many ways to go about this but that none forego coin. Trade would be one means to this end, fighting and selling off captured bandits in town another. Whatever path you choose to pursue, travelling alone would make you easy pickings for whomever came across your trail.{NEWLINE}You know that you can recruit men to follow you from the notables of villages and towns, though they may ask you for a favor or two of their own before they allow you access to their more valued fighters.{NEWLINE}Naturally, you may also find more unique characters in the taverns of Calradia. However, these tend to favor more established clans.
You've pledged your allegiance to the {KINGDOM_NAME}!
Very well - I'll duel you.
A landlord's retainers
{MENTOR.LINK} notified you about a weapons caravan that will supply conspirators with weapons and armour.

When it was just us fighting the horse archers, we were winning.. A man on foot can shoot as well or better than a man on horseback, all things being equal, and there were a lot more of us. So they started to go down and galloped off. The knights of course pursued, and that's when the problems started.

We had no choice but to go to war. Anyone who tells you they would have done otherwise is either a liar or a coward or both. The Sturgians attacked us, and needed to be chastised. We lost an army and a banner. But we did not lose our honor, and without honor the Empire would be finished.
Weaken Empire
We heard you took our little brother and sister. Where are they?
Your father was a trusted lieutenant of the local landowning aristocrat. He rode with the lord's cavalry, fighting as an armored lancer.
Let's go on then. (Play the combat tutorial)
Conspiracy Commander{%Commander is male.}

Your family arranged for you to accompany a minor baron of the Vlandian kingdom. You were not given major responsibilities - mostly carrying messages and tending to his horse -- but it did give you a chance to see how campaigns were planned and men were deployed in battle.
Атакуйце зверху.

I found this strange looking metal piece though. It doesn't look too valuable, but it could be the artifact {TACTEOS.NAME} was talking about. Maybe we can sell it to one of the noble clans for a hefty price.
Your parents were healers who gathered herbs and treated the sick. As a living reservoir of Battanian tradition, they were also asked to adjudicate many disputes between the clans.

I have a better idea. We would have a better chance if we split up now. I'll take {RADAGOS.NAME} and go find the slaver market and look for a way to free the children. However we must be careful not to endanger their lives and it could be better to just buy them. We need to have our purses full for that though.

Your family were the trusted kinsfolk of a Khuzait noyan, and shared his meals in the chieftain's yurt. Your father assisted his chief in running the affairs of the clan and fought in the core of armored lancers in the center of the Khuzait battle line.

Like many families in Calradia, your life was upended by war. Your home was ravaged by the passage of army after army. Eventually, you sold your property and set off with your father, mother, brother, and your two younger siblings to a new town you'd heard was safer. But you did not make it. Along the way, the inn at which you were staying was attacked by raiders. Your parents were slain and your two youngest siblings seized, but you and your brother survived because...
Yes. It was madness. The greatest blow struck against the Empire in a lifetime, and we squandered it squabbling among ourselves about a flag.
Purchase {GRAIN}
Select your family name:
Look around the village to find the party that captured the traveller whom the headman told you about.
You heard that a conspiracy started against you. Try to stop that.
So, can you help me find a buyer for it.

Before I reveal that information to you. I need to know more about your intentions. One could use the banner to restore the empire, but one could also use the banner to destroy it.[sp:/Sounds/VO/mainquest/mntemp_q01_06.ogg]
Let's go.
Your family needed someone trustworthy to take a caravan to a neighboring town. You organized supplies, ensured a constant watch to keep away bandits, and brought it safely to its destination.
One more thing. When you are talking to nobles and other people of importance, make sure you present yourself as someone from a distant but distinguished family.
You couldn't complete the quest in time.

You were quick on your feet and attentive to what was going on around you. Usually you could run away from trouble, though you could give a good account of yourself in a fight with other children if cornered.

Your family numbered among the many poor migrants living in the slums that grow up outside the walls of imperial cities, making whatever money they could from a variety of odd jobs. Sometimes they did service for one of the Empire's many criminal gangs, and you had an early look at the dark side of life.
You could not weaken the Empire.
You barely escaped with your life.
Headman {HEADMAN.FIRSTNAME}
I hold the Dragon Banner, and thus I am the legitimate ruler of the Empire of Calradia.
I am not ready yet.

And since I have nothing of value left to repay your help, I'll tell you this. If you do catch up with and defeat that ruffian, you may be able to recover my chest. It contains a valuable ornament which I was told could be of great value, if you knew where to sell it.
To hell with that! Why would I want to duel with you?
About giving the Dragon Banner to an existing kingdom...
You are not strong enough to attack. Recruit more troops from the village.
in the markets and caravanserais.
I'm listening..

My husband's small force held together, and were joined by stragglers and fugitives. He described the march back - no food, little water, marching day and night to keep ahead of the enemy's outriders. But they survived - the only organized imperial force to do so.
I present you with the Dragon Banner of Calradios.

You went with other fleet-footed youths to take the villages' sheep, goats or cattle to graze in pastures near the village. You were in charge of chasing down stray beasts, and always kept a big stone on hand to be hurled at lurking predators if necessary.

Your family were smiths, a revered profession among the Battanians. They crafted everything from fine filigree jewelry in geometric designs to the well-balanced longswords favored by the Battanian aristocracy.
You're ready to leave now. Talk to the headman again. He had said he have a task for you.
Are you ready to leave here?
Yes. We will never forget that day... The day we learned that the old men who claimed they had the right to rule us were doddering incompetents.

At the end of the day, what have we gained? The Sturgians hate us worse than ever. The Vlandians too. The Empire, I suppose, is shattered. What can I say... I believe that wars should have a goal. But I am a minority, it seems, among our people.
your leadership skills.
you had a famous escapade in town.
You have decided to keep the Dragon Banner within the new kingdom you've created.
You talked with {HERO.NAME}.
Wrong way!

The Battanians had planned an ambush up in a wooded pass for the imperial vanguard, then the Vlandians and Sturgians were to come sweeping down on their flanks in the battle. Our scouts found the Battanian ambush, but Neretzes did not listen, and blundered into it anyway.
Go to shooting position
So... If you intend to use the banner to save the Empire, I'll tell you what I know. But if you want to go backward, not forward, then I will not help you.

We fought the Vlandians. We won, but there was a great slaughter. My husband's horse was slain and he was ridden down, though he died amid a pile of Vlandian dead. Elsewhere on the field, the Emperor was having his head hewn off with a Sturgian axe, and thus was in no position to pay us.

The Khergits were never the richest of the clans, but we made up for it with our valor. When word spread that the Emperor was promising silver for men to ride at his side, against the Sturgians and Battanians and others, of course our young brave boys lept at the chance. My husband, the bravest and best of them all, led them.
I shall. For your many crimes, {RADAGOS.NAME}, your life is forfeit.
As you leave the hideout, {RADAGOS.LINK} comes to you and asks to talk.
Yes. The Emperor Neretzes had offered to hire our warriors as mercenaries. I saw nothing wrong with that.
Peace Offer from the {FACTION}
One other thing, {?PLAYER.GENDER}sister{?}brother{\?}. We want people to take us seriously. We may be leading men into battle soon. Let's give our family a name and a banner, like the nobles do.

Maybe it was a love affair, or maybe you cheated at dice, or maybe you just chose your words poorly when drinking with a dangerous crowd. Anyway, you got into the kind of trouble from which only a quick tongue or quick feet get you out alive.

While Neretzes' vanguard was getting slaughtered, we met the Vlandians. But the Vlandians brought lots of crossbowmen, and our horse archers took heavy losses. Eventually the armored imperial cataphracts showed up, and rolled over the crossbows. But we were caught in a melee with the Vlandian knights, and that was where things got bloody.
You have eliminated all {RAIDER_NAME} gangs in the vicinity.
Yes. The day my father died, thanks to Battanian treachery.

A few hours after you leave the training ground, you come across a wounded man lying under a tree. You share your water with him and try to dress his wounds as best as you can. He tells you he is a traveling doctor. To thank you for your help, he hands you a small bronze artifact which he says was once given to him in payment by a warrior who said only that it was related to 'Neretzes' Folly.' He suspects it might be of great value. You resolve to find out more.
You have defeated {BOSS_NAME} in a fair duel his men the conspirators scatters and runs away in shame.
Next, your clan's renown must have spread far and wide, or no one will take you seriously.
You worked in the marketplace, selling trinkets and drinks to busy shoppers.
You encouraged the few travellers in the inn to break out in a coordinated fashion. Raiders killed or captured most but you and your brother were able to escape.
There's this wandering doctor who comes through here from time to time. Name of Tacteos. Treats people for free... We're fond of him.

Your family were the trusted kinfolk of a Battanian chieftain, and sat at his table in his great hall. Your father assisted his chief in running the affairs of the clan and trained with the traditional weapons of the Battanian elite, the two-handed sword or falx and the bow.
Okay brother, be careful. Take care.
Yes, I intend to use the banner to help save the Empire.
Ah... Well, I suppose we can drop the charade. I know who sent you, and I suppose you know who sent me. Certainly, you can see my wares, and then you can feel their sharp end in your belly.
Young Adulthood
A boyar's companions
Your family had just enough land to feed themselves and make a small profit. People like them were the pillars of the kingdom's economy, as well as the backbone of the levy.
Don't hurt us![ib:weary][if:convo_confused_annoyed]
your skill with horses.
This looks like an old training field for the legions. Perhaps we can spare some time and brush up on our skills. The practice could come in handy when we catch up with the raiders.
reading and studying.

Your family was from a smaller offshoot of an emir's tribe. Your father's land gave him enough income to afford a horse but he was not quite wealthy enough to buy the armor needed to join the heavier cavalry. He fought as one of the light horsemen for which the desert is famous.
I would recommend that you gather a fairly large army, as you may soon be at war with more powerful and established realms.
But in return, I will have the pleasure of killing that bastard. So what do you say?[if:convo_mocking_revenge][ib:confident]
I don't duel slavers. Men, attack!
You have lost the battle against raiders and failed to defeat conspiracy forces. Many of the locals feel that you've brought misfortune upon them, and want nothing to do with you.
So, where can I find the other pieces?
Clearly you have been chosen by Heaven for a great purpose. I see the makings of a new legend here... Allow me to call you 'Bannerlord.'
you led a successful manhunt.
If you can keep an eye out for him, this Tacteos, we'd be very grateful. Maybe, if he's alive and well, he'll tell you a little more about his 'quest.'
How can I support an existing kingdom?
You encountered the raider party.
There is an army waiting for you outside,
I do not know where the other pieces are, you may need to keep searching for them.[sp:/Sounds/VO/mainquest/mntemp_q01_10.ogg]
He led us here. Where are my brothers and my sister?
You have decided to unify the Empire.

You told {MENTOR.LINK} that you will create your own imperial faction. You can do that through the Clan screen once you fulfill the requirements. {?MENTOR.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} expects to talk to you once you succeed.
You've successfully beaten rookie trainer. Go to veteran trainer.
To have a chance as an imperial contender, you must fullfil some conditions.

You were always drawn to animals, and spent as much time as possible hanging out in the village stables. You could calm horses, and were sometimes called upon to break in new colts. You learned the basics of veterinary arts, much of which is applicable to humans as well.
I was there. Many of the Khuzaits went. Mostly the Khergit clan, who were hungry for glory, but I was also young and hungry for glory so I went along as well.

Well, if they're still pillaging they may have split up into smaller groups. Hopefully we won't need to take them all on at once. But it would help if we could hire or persuade some people to join us.
You left the kingdom you have created. You can only support kingdoms that you are a part of.
at the town watch's training ground.
You and your men have defeated {BOSS_NAME} and the rest of the conspirators as {MENTOR.LINK} asked you to do.

My spy spotted conspiracy troops at the camp.. Some local bandits have joined them. My spy does not know if they are expecting attack, so I implore you to be cautious and to be ready for anything. Needless to say, I'm sure you will send any documents you can find to me so I can study them. Go quickly and return safely.
Find the hideout of {RADAGOS.NAME}'s gang and defeat them
Gather {PARTY_SIZE} Troops
Right then, to the business of bringing down this cursed Empire. As I see it, you have two options...
You have collected enough information.
Travel To Village {VILLAGE_NAME}
So have you made up your mind now?
All right then. Let's get on the road.

They had overextended themselves, chasing the imperial archers. Light foot before our knights - there was no contest. Let me tell you something - nine-tenths of victory is recognizing when your enemy has made a mistake. The rash perish as swiftly as the weak, and deserve it just as much.
I curse that name. It took from me my husband, two brothers, more cousins than I can count.
You should join the kingdom that you wish to support by talking to the leader. None will bring back the Palaic people, but the final victory of any one of those would be suitable vengeance.

Choose one and pledge allegiance. When this civil war began, I was a bit torn... Rhagaea was the cleverest ruler, Garios probably the best fighter, and Lucon seemed to have the best grasp of our laws and traditions. But you can make up your own mind.
joined the skirmishers.

You rescue several prisoners that the raiders had been dragging along. They look parched and exhausted. You give them a bit of water and bread, and after a short while one staggers to his feet and comes over to you.

You were defeated by the raiders, but your brother saved you. It doesn't look like they're going anywhere, though, so you should attack again once you're ready.{NEWLINE}You must have at least {NUMBER} members in your party. If you don't, go back to the village and recruit some more troops.

I was with the vanguard. Neretzes apparently knew that the Battanians had planned an ambush - the Khuzait scouts had told him. But he never bothered to inform us. So up we went, along a lovely wooded stream, until the Battanian arrows started whooshing in from all sides.
You should collect all of the pieces of the Dragon Banner before deciding your path.
Weakened by the war, the {FACTION} has collapsed and its clans have defected to surrounding kingdoms.
{MENTOR.NAME} knows of the rise of your {KINGDOM_NAME}. Rumors say {MENTOR.NAME} is planning to undo your progress. Be ready!
The headman here can probably help us. Let's try to find him...
Urban blacksmith
I'll take {LITTLE_SISTER.LINK} and {LITTLE_BROTHER.LINK} to {SETTLEMENT_LINK} immediately. They will be safe there.

If you want more information, there are two people you might try to speak to. {IMPERIAL_MENTOR.NAME} worked as a sort of unofficial spymaster for Neretzes. She lives near {IMPERIAL_MENTOR_SETTLEMENT}.
We're here, I guess. So... We need food, and after that, maybe some men to come with us.
You escaped? Where's my brother? What happened?
Story Background
{PLAYER.NAME}! I knew you'd come. Great Heaven. Damn, {?PLAYER.GENDER}sister{?}brother{\?}, nothing can stop you! I love you, {?PLAYER.GENDER}sister{?}brother{\?}.[if:happy][ib:demure]
{ANTIIMPERIAL_MENTOR.NAME}'s Conspiracy
Your family were part of a nomadic clan, crisscrossing the wastes between wadi beds and wells to feed their herds of goats and camels on the scraggly scrubs of the Nahasa.
I know where {HIDEOUT_BOSS.LINK} is now. If you agree, we can attack together and save your kin.
You may have one piece of the banner, but it's of little use in itself. You'll have to find the other parts. But once you can bring together the pieces, you'll have something of tremendous value.
Well now. I had heard rumors that you had obtained this great artifact.
You've found the {BANNER_PIECE_COUNT} banner piece!
Interactions are limited during tutorial phase. This interaction is disabled.
I mean you no harm. We're hunting a group of raiders who took our brother and sister.

Your parents didn't give you much money, but they did leave just enough for you to secure a loan against a larger amount to build a small workshop. You paid back what you borrowed, and sold your enterprise for a profit.
So! You have much to do. I will await news of your success. Return to me when you wish to declare your ownership of the banner to the world.
Then there is {ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.NAME}, who was his bodyguard. He's supposed to be near {ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR_SETTLEMENT} - though I hear he's changed quite a bit since then.
Clan Independence
sold produce at the market.

There was a warrior named Nimr, of the Bani Sarran. He was brave, but arrogant. Of course the young people loved him. He wanted to lead men to fight with the Empire, and though there was no gain for us, Unqid let him. Unqid can be weak sometimes.
That you did, that you did. Lead on, then.[ib:closed][if:convo_nonchalant]
Бараніцеся знізу.
All right then. Let us split up and look for the little ones separately. I'll send you a word if I find them before you do...
You have defeated all the raiders near {MENTOR.LINK}. Many people now hope you can bring peace and prosperity back to the region.
you organized the travelers to break out.
Get on the road now. Once I locate the little ones, I'll come find you.
You've successfully finished the track in ({TIME_SCORE}) seconds. You've received ({PENALTY_SECONDS}) seconds penalty from ({MISSED_TARGETS}) missed targets.
you had a famous escapade.
You talked with {HERO.LINK}.
You watched the town's watch practice shooting and perfect their plans to defend the walls in case of a siege.
You should join a kingdom before supporting it with the Dragon Banner.
Your family were merchants in one of the main cities of the kingdom. They organized caravans to nearby towns, were active in the local merchant's guild.

Nothing can bring the Palaic people back. They are now imperial. But is an insult to our name, to our gods, to our memory, that the state which destroyed our shrines and fortresses should last and thrive.
A conspiracy war party is now patrolling around {SETTLEMENT}.
I was hoping to find more treasure here, but I think business wasn't going too well for {RADAGOS.NAME} and his gang.

Your family came from one of the merchant clans that dominated the cities in eastern Calradia before the Khuzait conquest. They adjusted quickly to their new masters, keeping the caravan routes running and ensuring that the tariff revenues that once went into imperial coffers now flowed to the khanate.
your attention to detail.
What is 'Neretzes' Folly'?
Hunt the conspiracy war party
Reach Clan Tier {CLAN_TIER}
So... Who's this that comes through my place of business, killing my employees?[if:idle_angry][ib:warrior]
I am what they call Palaic. Palaic is a language that is no longer spoken, except by a few old people. Even the word 'Palaic' is imperial. We are a people who have forgotten who we are.
I have gathered all pieces of the Dragon Banner. What now?
You were defeated by the raiders in the hideout but you managed to escape. You need to wait to be able to attack again.
Reach Clan Tier 1
The Empire has been destroyed!
You've finally arrived! I have a few things to say to before we attack.[ib:confident][if:convo_nonchalant]
Maybe. Goodbye, {RADAGOS.NAME}...
He seemed to be controlling more than one band raiding around this area. If this lot has your kin, then I think he'd be the one to know.
You talked with {ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK} too. Now you should make a decision.

I will never forget when a messenger ran to tell me that my father was dead. But I knew I must swallow my grief, because now I was king. I rode down into the ruins of the imperial camp to take their banner as a trophy, my inheritance won by my father and passed down to me. Oh, some of the boyars were insubordinate. But I have since showed them that I am master.
You have arrived at the village. You can buy some food and hire some men to help hunt for the raiders. First go into the village and talk to the headman.
So you want me to raise the money to ransom the little ones?
herded the sheep.
You were a big and imposing enough youth that the chief's guard allowed you to train alongside them, in preparation to join them some day.
I have vowed that this Empire shall not survive this civil war, if I can do anything to stop it. And believe me, if I had that banner, there is very much something I could do.
You helped your family handle their business affairs, going down to the marketplace to make purchases and oversee the arrival of caravans.
Firstly, your clan must be independent. You cannot be pledged to an existing realm.

When they pledged to support us in the battle, we believed they would stand with us in the shield wall, like men. But of course this is not the Battanian way. They sprung some woodland trickery up in the hills, killed off Neretzes' vanguard, and no doubt spent the rest of the battle whooping and boasting and chopping the heads off of men who were already dead.

{MENTOR.LINK} told you about a group of conspirators operating in a hideout in the vicinity of their {LOCATION_LINK}. You should go there and raid the hideout with a small group of fighters and take the bandits by surprise.
You accompanied a local hunter as he went into the wilderness, helping him set up traps and catch small animals.
You talked with {IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK} too. Now you should make a decision.
No, I am still working on it...
This is one of the most valuable services anyone has ever done for me. I am very grateful.
You couldn't stop the conspiracy.
you saved your city quarter from a fire.

Old king Vadinslav was brave enough. He led us all into battle. I stood at my father's side as we faced the imperials eye-to-eye over the tops of our shields. It was like any battle where shield walls meet - thrust and push, struggling to stay on your feet, but you can't really describe it. Let's just say it's the kind of battle that Sturgians usually win.
I have heard no sweeter music than the thunder of our hooves as we bore down on the Aserai rabble. We fell on them like a falcon plunges upon a rabbit.

Of course Nimr's arrogance doubled, and doubled again. And then he dealt us a great insult. I will not say what that insult was, because it longer exists. We wiped it out. In the traditional way. You may ask someone else about that.
Well... King Caladog's great victory... Who would dare say anything to tarnish its shine?
Thank you...
You have unified the Empire.

When the imperials had had enough of us they broke and ran for the ramparts. There they threw darts and rocks and their cursed fire. We had to go up ladders, one by one. Vadinslav was hit by a mace and went down; my father then went up, cleaving as he went, and rallied us and led us to victory.

The banner of Calradios is part of a legend. It was said to be carried by Calradios the Great, who first led his people to this land, to conquer and despoil. The legend says that no army led by a true son of Calradios shall be defeated in battle.
Of course. I did not witness the battle, but my husband Arenicos spoke frequently of it.

My father took the imperial dragon banner from dead Neretzes' hands - it's a famous story - and but then the little prince Raganvad tried to claim it. My father broke it over his knee, threw it at him, and told him to get his own toys to play with. Hah! It was a good, good day.
We need help. Some raiders have taken our younger brother and sister captive. We think they may have passed this way.
Caravan is moving on to {TO_SETTLEMENT_LINK} from {FROM_SETTLEMENT_LINK}
You've lost. You can restart the training by interacting weapon rack.
Kinsfolk of an emir

All of Calradia's kingdoms recognize the value of good light cavalry, and are sure to recruit nomads and borderers with the skills to fulfill those duties. You were a good enough rider that your neighbors pitched in to buy you a small pony and a sheaf of javelins so that you could fulfill their levy obligations.
How so?
hunted small game.
{MENTOR.LINK} has a message for you

King Aeril disappeared while hunting, and Caladog becomes king. He leads the tribes to war. Oh, we were eager enough, even though Aeril had made a truce with the Emperor, sealed by oaths. When we were dazzled with the prospect of vengeance, who cares about our sacred word and honor?
Nobles to Talk to
You need to recruit more troops to deal with the raider party. Go back to village to recruit more troops.
You probably are aware that I am {CONVERSATION_HERO.FIRSTNAME}. I am not sure why you have sought me out, but know that my old life, as imperial lap-dog, is over.

Most of those who went were Khergits. They are a young clan. Their lineage is not like ours. They were always looking to prove themselves. Anyway, at the battle, their noyan, Solun, was slain alongside most of the males of his house. What can I say? A thirst for glory is dangerous, both to the thirsty one and those around him.
you hunted a dangerous animal.
Калі вы аднавіце ўсе часткі, вярніцеся да мяне, і я дапамагу вам выкарыстаць іх.
This option is disabled during current active quest.
If you win, I promise my army won't crush you.
Then you can come back when you made up your mind up.[sp:/Sounds/VO/mainquest/mntemp_q01_12.ogg]
repaired projects.
Glad to see you found what you needed. Now, about that matter I mentioned earlier...[if:convo_grave]
Next, your clan must have won for itself considerable renown, or no one will follow you.
Well, that should keep you busy for a while. Come back when you are ready.
Emperor Neretzes led an army accompanied by Khuzaits and Aserai to fight a coalition of Sturgians, Battanians and Vlandians.
I too would see the empire destroyed.
You'll without a doubt perish by my sword, but today is not the day.
Purchased {GRAIN} Amount
Fight will start in {REMAINING_TIME} {?REMAINING_TIME>1}seconds{?}second{\?}...
Urban back-alley thugs
gathered herbs in the wild.
How can I support an existing imperial claimant?
Thanks for saving me again. I hope our paths will cross again!
Many Battanians fight as kern, versatile troops who could both harass the enemy line with their javelins or join in the final screaming charge once it weakened.
Clan Tier
You have chosen a different path.
Use the portrait to talk and enter the mission.
How should we prepare for the fight?
Which kingdom should I support?
{MENTOR.LINK} suggested that you should support an imperial faction by offering them the Dragon Banner.

Look, there's a case for all of them. When this war began, I thought Rhagaea understood best how to rule, Garios was the strongest warrior, and Lucon had the firmest grasp of our traditions. Honestly I could not decide.
Well well, isn't this the famous {PLAYER.LINK}! You have been a thorn at our side for a while now. It's good that you are here now. It spares us from searching for you.[if:idle_angry][ib:warrior]
I believe I have a piece of the Dragon Banner of Calradios.

Your family owned their own workshop in a city, making goods from raw materials brought in from the countryside. Your father played an active if minor role in the town council, and also served in the militia.
Have you finished your preparations?
Impressive, most impressive. Well, things will get interesting now.
You were defeated by the {BOSS_NAME} in the duel. Your men takes your wounded body to the safety. As agreed, conspirators quickly leave and disappear without a trace.
Defeated Parties
It will be a powerful tool in our hands. People will believe that the Heavens intend us to restore the Empire of Calradia.
They got your people too? Sorry to hear that. Those bastards have done a bit of killing and looting in these parts as well.[if:convo_grave]
Heeding the advice of {MENTOR.LINK}, you have created an imperial faction. You can tell {?MENTOR.GENDER}her{?}him{\?} that you will support your own kingdom.
So. Who are you, and what brings you to me?
What scum, eh? Even in this profession, double-crossing your comrades is frowned upon.
Yes, I intend to use the banner to help destroy the empire.

Your family were middle-ranking members of one of the Khuzait clans. He had some herds of his own, but was not rich. When the Khuzait horde was summoned to battle, he fought with the horse archers, shooting and wheeling and wearing down the enemy before the lancers delivered the final punch.
You have eliminated a {RAIDER_NAME} party.
Is that true? Well, that is interesting.

Clans rise, clans fall. My duty is to all the Khuzaits. Look at it this way. Were it not for her husband's death, Lady Mesui would never have inherited the leadership of the Khergits. Death creates opportunity. The survivors of a great battle make a great show of mourning, but inside they rejoice.
{VICTIM}'s execution by {EXECUTER}
Urban artisans

{MENTOR.LINK}'s message: “Greetings, {PLAYER.NAME}. We have a new problem. I've had reports from my agents of unusual bandit activity near {TARGET_SETTLEMENT}. They appear to be raiding and killing travellers {?IS_EMPIRE}under the protection of the Empire{?}who aren't under the protection of the Empire{\?}, and leaving the others alone. This seems very much like the work of {NEMESIS_MENTOR.LINK}, to terrorize local merchants so that no one will stand up for our cause. I advise you to wipe these bandits out as quickly as possible. That would send a good message, both to our allies and our enemies.”

We had given an oath to the Empire, to join them if attacked. It seemed clear to me that we should have honored our oath, that the Battanians and Sturgians were aggressors, but, there is always room to argue details. Ultimately our barons did not wish to fight with the Empire, so they resisted coming to its help.
You have lost the battle against the conspiracy caravan and failed to stop them in time. A stronger adversary awaits us...

Oh you can't trust me. But you need me, and I figure you have enough men that you could easily slit my throat pretty quickly if I lead you into a trap. And I don't need to trust you - you're my vehicle of revenge, not my partner.
Recruit 4 recruits. Click "Recruit Troops" option on village menu to recruit troops.
You'd better help us get our brother and sister back, or you'll swing from a tree.
You've successfully finished the track in ({TIME_SCORE}) seconds without missing any targets!
You chose to defeat the Empire.
working at the stables.

The ambush... Masterfully planned and executed, that none can deny. But I will also not deny that the Sturgians fought the main body of the imperial forces, and the Vlandians fought their famous cavalry, so I don't think the greatest glory went to the sons of Battania.

It doesn't look like much and I suspect this lot would give it away for a few coins, but I got it from a mercenary whom I treated once, and swore it was related to 'Neretzes's Folly'. I don't know what that means except that Neretzes was of course the emperor who died in battle some years back. Maybe you can find out its true value.
Companion Hired
rode with the scouts.
Buy products
You were defeated by the raiders in the hideout but you managed to escape. You need to wait to be able to attack again.
You haven't cut my throat yet, which was a wise move. I'm sure I can find a way to be worth more to you alive than dead.
You were always attentive to other people, good at guessing their motivations. You studied how individuals were swayed, and tried out what you learned from adults on your friends.
You can dismount from horse with {CROUCH_KEY}, or {ACTION_KEY} while looking at the horse.
Eh, well, I dared to hope, I suppose. All right then, I'm not going to grovel to you, so get it over with.

I stayed with Neretzes until we were forced back to our camp by the Sturgian infantry, and then fought on the battlements. Eventually we could hold them no longer. I did not see what happened to Neretzes or to our banner. Arenicos got us out of there, and got us home. I did not respect Arenicos before, but that day I saw he was worthy to be Emperor.
you survived a siege.
You prepare to set off with your brother on a mission of vengeance and rescue. Here is your character. Continue if you are ready, or go back to make changes.

Your family were middle-ranking members of a Battanian clan, who tilled their own land. Your father fought with the kern, the main body of his people's warriors, joining in the screaming charges for which the Battanians were famous.

He set off on the road just a few hours before the raiders come through here. Well, he's not really a worldly type, just the kind of fellow who'd stumble into a trap and let himself be captured. We're worried about him.
I'm still working on it.
Weakened by war, the ruler of the {FACTION} offers to make peace with {PLAYER_FACTION}.
you led a caravan.
Choose a weapon to begin training.

We should have gone on to seize all the western empire. If Derthert had any manhood, we'd have done so. But his heart was never in the war. He believed he'd broken his oath to the Empire by helping the Sturgians, and it gnawed at him. He'd have made a fine lackey. Instead he's our king.
You were defeated by the bandits in the hideout but you managed to escape. You need to wait a while before attacking again.
You have weakened the Empire.

Your family were guardians of the sacred traditions of the Khuzaits, channelling the spirits of the wilderness and of the ancestors. They tended the sick and dispensed wisdom, resolving disputes and providing practical advice.
Find another piece of the banner for Istiana

Look, right before the battle, our high king, Aeril, disappears. And his adopted son Caladog becomes king. That sets tongues to wagging, you know? But let me tell you - old Aeril could never in his life won such a victory as did Caladog, that day.
Find the hideout that Arzagos told you about and get the next banner piece.
A 'buyer'? Think bigger than that. Let me just say that, if you can find the missing pieces, I am sure I can help you put it to good use.

Since your hunt for your kin is fruitless, how about you clear off and save your own lives? Either that or I force you to lick up all the blood you've spilled here with your tongues. Or... You and I could settle this, one on one.[ib:confident]
Right click to defend
Like all village children you helped out in the fields. You also...

Your family had no taste for the authority of the boyars. They made their living deep in the woods, slashing and burning fields which they tended for a year or two before moving on. They hunted and trapped fox, hare, ermine, and other fur-bearing animals.
you saved your village from a flood.
We found your little brother and sister. But my former partner {HIDEOUT_BOSS.LINK} betrayed me. We came into his camp to negotiate the kids' release, and he seized us right then and there.

When they were all good and addled like frightened sheep, running this way and that, the rest of us warriors descended upon them with our falxes and swords. I cleaved this way and that. I took 12 heads, and mine was far from the greatest catch. Ah, the grandchildren tire of me telling this story...
A victory, won by my father, claimed by Raganvad.
Атакуйце знізу.
Yes, we are all fine. {LITTLE_SISTER.LINK} and {LITTLE_BROTHER.LINK} are scared but fine... We need to be quick and get the hell out of this place.[if:idle_insulted][ib:closed]
I could feel the signs of heat-stroke creeping up and I told them but they just flogged me more... If your group hadn't come along... Maybe I have a way to thank you properly.

Now, the Empire uses tricks and traps in war. No Battanian fears to meet an imperial soldier, man-to-man, but we thought it would be a good laugh to use their tricks against them. So we laid an ambush, on both sides of a wooded pass, and wouldn't you know? They marched right into it.

Nimr returned, in well-deserved glory. A daughter of the Banu Qild took an interest in him, and they had a secret affair, as the youth sometimes do. As heroes do. But Nimr's acts wounded the Qildi's pride. They kidnapped him, slew him and hung him in a cage in their market. We will forgive the Empire and the Vlandians. The Qildis... better not ask me that.
Well, we last saw him a few days ago. He was carrying some sort of chest, which he was very mysterious about. He was on some sort of 'quest', he said, though wouldn't tell us more.
You were born into a family of...
There was never a prouder moment for the Bani Sarran.

Of course our glorious armies have been defeated many times, but I guess those commanders and emperors were not 'true sons.' Clever little legend. A child could see through it, if she tried, but of course people never try to see through the noble lies that bind us together. Thank Heaven for that.

I did not fight in the battle. I stood on a hill telling my commanders where to go and who to attack. And we did rather well, I think you've heard. Still, we took losses - heavy losses, and gained little. And for this the barons blamed me, even though it was their idea to fight. I learned that day that a king should always lead, never follow. But it was a bitter lesson.
Calm down, now. I'll tell you everything.
you invested some money in land.
Collected Pieces
This option will end the tutorial!
{PLAYER_FATHER.NAME} was the father of {PLAYER.LINK}. He was slain when raiders attacked the inn at which his family was staying.
I'm listening.
you invested some money in a workshop.

{PLAYER.LINK} I hope this letter finds you well. I have learned from a spy in {LOCATION_LINK} that our adversaries have set up a camp in its environs. She could not tell me what they plan to do, but if you raided the camp, stole some of their supplies, and brought it back to me, we could get some idea of their wicked intentions. Search around {LOCATION_LINK} to find the hideout.
Take a walk around
You were defeated by the raiders in the hideout but you managed to escape. You need to wait a while before attacking again.
Support {?IS_IMPERIAL}an imperial faction{?}a non-imperial kingdom{\?}
You've successfully hit all of the targets in ({TIME_SCORE}) seconds.
{FACTION} Defeated
I might be. What are you carrying? Honest goods, or weapons? How about you let us have a look.
Disrupt Supply Lines
Recruit Troops
your aptitude for numbers.
You were apprenticed to the local smith. You learned how to heat and forge metal, hammering for hours at a time until your muscles ached.
I am a busy man, but there is always time to talk about the blessed battle of Pendraic.
Meet with {HERO.NAME}
Assemble the Dragon Banner
Unify the Empire

The tracks look fresh, and I've seen some smoke on the horizon. They can't move too quickly if they're still looting and raiding. No, I'm pretty sure we'll be able to rescue the little ones... or die trying.
Firstly, your clan must be independent. You cannot be pledged to an existing realm.
I am {HEADMAN.FIRSTNAME}, headman of this village. What brings you here?
Beat the trainer!
I wonder which imperial faction I should support..
Conspiracy is activated!
You were big, and other children looked to have you around in any scrap with children from a neighboring village. You pushed a plough and throw an axe like an adult.

You talked with {IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK}. Now, you may want to talk with {ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK} and take {?ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} opinions too. {?ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} is currently in {SETTLEMENT_LINK}.
Uh, how can we possibly trust each other?
you treated people well.
Yes. I was a junior officer on Neretzes' staff. People say much about the battle that betrays a lack of understanding, of Neretzes and of the circumstances he faced.

Your family lived in a village, but did not own their own land. Instead, your father supplemented paid jobs with long trips in the woods, hunting and trapping, always keeping a wary eye for the lord's game wardens.
As you explore Calradia, you can learn more about your artifact and its importance by asking any lord or lady about the Empire's recent history.

You talked with {ANTI_IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK}. Now, you may want to talk with {IMPERIAL_MENTOR.LINK} and take {?IMPERIAL_MENTOR.GENDER}her{?}his{\?} opinions too. {?IMPERIAL_MENTOR.GENDER}She{?}He{\?} is currently in {SETTLEMENT_LINK}.

Your father joined one of Vlandia's many mercenary companies, composed of men who got such a taste for war in their lord's service that they never took well to peace. Their crossbowmen were much valued across Calradia. Your mother was a camp follower, taking you along in the wake of bloody campaigns.
Send in your troops.
You have arrived at the hideout.
Achievements are disabled!

When a sudden blaze broke out in a back alley, your neighbors needed quick-thinking leadership and you provided it. You organized a bucket line to the nearest well, putting the fire out before any homes were lost.
Go to trainer.

You may have one piece of the banner, but it's of little use in itself. You'll have to find the other parts. But once you can bring together the pieces, you'll have something of tremendous value.[sp:/Sounds/VO/mainquest/mntemp_q01_03.ogg]
Wait here for some time
Well. I recognize defeat when I see it. If I'm going to be your captive, let me introduce myself. I'm Radagos.

{MENTOR.LINK} has sent you a message: An arms caravan will be resupplying conspirators and insurgents will be soon on its way.{newline}{MENTOR.LINK}'s message:{newline}"Our Spies have learned about an arms caravan which is out to supply conspirators with finest weapon and armours possible. We know that it will start it's route from {QUEST_FROM_SETTLEMENT_NAME} to {QUEST_TO_SETTLEMENT_NAME} after {SPAWN_DAYS} days. We will find out and notify you about the new routes that it takes as and if it progresses."

They say Olek the Old had pried the dragon banner out of the Emperor's dead hands. But then Prince Raganvad, who had not so much as drawn his sword in the battle, claimed it as a trophy. Olek, who was covered in his enemies' blood, laughed at Raganvad and told him to go find his own toy to play with. Raganvad struck him, so Olek broke the banner staff over his knee and threw it in his prince's face.

Your family owned their own workshop in a city, making goods from raw materials brought in from the countryside. Your father played an active if minor role in the town council, and also served in the militia.
